definition: easily stretched, the act of physically reaching or thrusting out, extend one's limbs or muscles, or the entire body
details:
adjective
- easily stretched
= example: easily stretched
- having an elongated seating area
noun
- the act of physically reaching or thrusting out
= synonyms: reaching
- extension to or beyond the ordinary limit
= example: extension to or beyond the ordinary limit
- exercise designed to extend the limbs and muscles to their full extent
= synonyms: stretching
- a straightaway section of a racetrack
- the capacity for being stretched
= synonyms: stretchiness, stretchability
- a large and unbroken expanse or distance
= example: a large and unbroken expanse or distance
- an unbroken period of time during which you do something
= example: an unbroken period of time during which you do something
= synonyms: stint
verb
- extend one's limbs or muscles, or the entire body
= synonyms: extend
- extend one's body or limbs
= example: extend one's body or limbs
= synonyms: stretch out
- increase in quantity or bulk by adding a cheaper substance
= example: increase in quantity or bulk by adding a cheaper substance
= synonyms: extend
- become longer by being stretched and pulled
= example: become longer by being stretched and pulled
- make long or longer by pulling and stretching
= example: make long or longer by pulling and stretching
= synonyms: elongate
- corrupt, debase, or make impure by adding a foreign or inferior substance
= synonyms: dilute
- extend the scope or meaning of
- pull in opposite directions
= example: pull in opposite directions
- lie down comfortably
= example: lie down comfortably
= synonyms: stretch out
- extend or stretch out to a greater or the full length
= synonyms: extend, stretch out, unfold
- occupy a large, elongated area
= example: occupy a large, elongated area
= synonyms: stretch along
